page.title: 18Poems 1.
page.content:
{King William (by J.Dixon age 10yrs)
King William came from Normandy, And sailed across the English sea. He had his eye on Harold's throne, And wanted England as his own./ William landed at Pevensey Bay, Harold went to meet him, He had an army strong and bold, And thought that he would beat him,/ King Harold's men were on a hill, King Harold stood up high, A Norman arrow whizzed past them, And struck him in the eye./ King William had a Domesday book, It was a great long list, Of all the people in the land, And nobody was missed./ Then William sent his nobles round, To see what people owned, And then he knew what tax to charge, But many people moaned.
